home.TextParagraphOne: Human-centred design (HCD) is an approach to problem-solving that prioritizes the needs, desires, and behaviours of the people who will use the product, system, or service.
home.TextParagraphTwo: It involves understanding users perspectives through observation, interviews,and empathy-building exercises.
home.TextParagraphThree: By focusing on the human experience, HCD aims to create products and services that are intuitive, user-friendly, and ultimately more effective in addressing real-world challenges.

me.TextParagraphOne:
My name is
Gabriel Arturo Garcia Diaz.
me.TextParagraphTwo: I love creating simple but comprehensive solutions for all kinds of users as an Accessibility lover.
me.TextParagraphThree: With a background in graphic design, UX/UI web design and graphic arts production I’m constantly looking for new ways to guarantee my designs are stunning to view but also incredibly user-friendly.
me.TextParagraphFour: As an Accessibility programmer and web designer and with my graphic design skills, I combine my code passion and a whole bag of design tricks to ensure every project I touch is a masterpiece.
